short: Your dad wants Mozart in the car and you want Eminem? That's an irreconcilable difference right there ā two tastes or ideas or preferences so different from each other there can be no compatibility or middle ground. Diplomacy can't help, only headphones.
long: Where would divorce lawyers be without this lovely word irreconcilable? Their clients don't just have differences with their spouses, they have "irreconcilable differences" ā in other words, demands or points of view so distant from each other they can never be bought together. Bye-bye marriage, hello legal fees.
